Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and marketing this, promotion that,... sure it is a good tiebreaker for projects that are all about the same. but my guess is that the model T car didnt need a lot of paid promotion when it came out against the horse and buggy. so new tech does win, in spite of existing competition having all the marketing. how did the horse buggy end up? did it matter who on youtube was promoting them? of what sort of hype was created?

for those of you that are pushing for us to hype, you are pushing us to make exaggerated claims, but that just goes against our nature. We will make claims that we can support

Author: bogybogy#3962
Content:
Supply and demand is perhaps one of the most fundamental concepts of economics and it is the backbone of a market economy. Demand refers to how much (quantity) of a product or service is desired by buyers. The quantity demanded is the amount of a product people are willing to buy at a certain price; the relationship between price and quantity demanded is known as the demand relationship. Supply represents how much the market can offer. The quantity supplied refers to the amount of a certain good producers are willing to supply when receiving a certain price. The correlation between price and how much of a good or service is supplied to the market is known as the supply relationship. Price, therefore, is a reflection of supply and demand.

The relationship between demand and supply underlie the forces behind the allocation of resources. In market economy theories, demand and supply  will allocate resources in the most efficient way possible.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Last reminder I'm going to give about this. LABS is running a provably fair lottery to add two additional NNs. You have about 3 more hours to sign up. Come by #kmdlabs channel, if you're interested.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Great way to learn the underlying tech behind dpow and komodo in general, getting a spot as an NN basically forces you to learn

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Launch of the chain is slated for ~Wednesday, it's been about 10 months in the making, a long time coming üòÉ

Author: crumb#2550
Content: what are the prerequisites (if there are any)?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: understand how to use a terminal and be willing to learn

Author: crumb#2550
Content: what hardware, VPS etc

Author: Alright#0419
Content: can get by with 4gb 4core with swapspace

Author: Alright#0419
Content: recommended is 8gb 4 core

Author: crumb#2550
Content: so reasonably old laptop will do

Author: crumb#2550
Content: or beefier hw is preferred?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: 20% of emissions overall goes to NNs, they'll eventually be making more on top of that once we have fungible chains up and running. The person(or entity) creating the fungible chain essentially puts a "bid" in for what they agree to pay notaries. Notaries then have the freedom to decide whether or not they will notarize it at the rate offered

Author: Alright#0419
Content: something hosted in a DC is highly recommended

Author: Alright#0419
Content: your node is not likely to perform well otherwise. Better connection( and hardware to some extent) = more money as it's pay per notarization

Author: crumb#2550
Content: aaah yes of course. makes sense

Author: phm87#7395
Content: @Alright if we loose at the lottery, what is the next timeslot for the next lottery to get a kmdlabs NN seat ?

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Next year ? Next month ?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: 2 months

Author: Alright#0419
Content: every 2 months we will add 2 additional spots if we have people that want them

Author: Alright#0419
Content: until we hit 64 total

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the only way to lose a spot is to be <25% average notarization count for the 2 month period

Author: Alright#0419
Content: might have to revisit that, but for now it's set up to where if you even try you won't lose the spot

Author: Alright#0419
Content: someone not notarizing doesn't have much of a negative effect other than them making less money overall

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so anyone *trying* is welcome to keep trying

Author: phm87#7395
Content: So the only NN network accessible to everybody without votes or lottery is the NN testnet 2019

Author: Alright#0419
Content: At the moment, yes. We'll be reworking the CFEK network to be more of a testnet after launch

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Right now, the CFEK network uses the same keys as the LABS network. We'll be separating them, so CFEK can add/remove people on a whim
